title: Storm Amy hits parts of UK with heavy rain and strong winds
description: Some schools in Northern Ireland are closed, while several rail services and ferries in Scotland have been cancelled.
content:
Storm Amy has swept into the UK, bringing heavy rain and strong winds to large parts of the country.
An amber wind warning is in place for parts of northern and western Scotland, where the Met Office is warning of power cuts and flying debris that co... [2026 chars]

title: Electric car sales hit record high in September
description: Sales of fully electric or hybrid vehicles made up more than half of all new car registrations in the UK last month.
content:
Electric vehicle (EV) sales in the UK hit a record high last month, according to the latest industry figures.
Sales of pure battery electric vehicles (BEV) grew by almost a third to 72,779 in September, according to the Society of Motor Manufacturers... [1183 chars]

title: 'Best month ever' for UK battery electric vehicle sales
description: The Society for Motor Manufacturers and Traders attributed the rise to the government's Electric Car Grant scheme, along with factors such as an "ever-increasing choice of models".
content:
Nearly a quarter of vehicles sold in the UK last month were battery electric (BEV) models, according to industry figures.
More than 72,000 new BEVs were registered in September, accounting for 23.3% of the total market, the Society for Motor Manufact... [2542 chars]

title: Why you should always pack a tennis ball in your carry-on luggage
description: From hand sanitiser to a neck pillow, there are plenty of items travellers are often told are essential to pack in their carry-on luggage.
content:
From hand sanitiser to a neck pillow, there are plenty of items travellers are often told are essential to pack in their carry-on luggage.

title: Quin-demic fear: As Covid surges, flu and RSV are also on the rise sparking warnings NHS could be overwhelmed and operations cancelled
description: A leading virologist has warned if cases of five common illnesses in the colder months soar, it will put 'extreme' pressure on the NHS.
content:
The UK could be hit by a 'quin-demic' of winter viruses—Covid, flu, RSV, rhinovirus and norovirus—putting 'extreme' pressure on the NHS, experts warn.
Two new Covid variants, Stratus and Nimbus, are already fuelling a surge in infections, with cases ... [5043 chars]
